694330.trustfund:
TF025168-PHRD-VOCAT. TRAIN. & LABOR
            MARKET STRENG,TF021246-STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT PROGRAM 1995-1996,TF020831-STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT 95-96 (ESECAL)

repnme.cdata!: Mali - Education Sector Adjustment Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Education Sector Adjustment Credit
            (ESAC) in Mali. The reforms that were promoted through this
            credit aimed at establishing conditions conducive to
            accelerating the development of primary education, through
            improving quality at all levels, better adjusting
            post-primary education to labor market demands and
            strengthening of management capacity in the sector. The main
            policy objectives were as follows: (a) improved allocation
            of resources; (b) increased efficiency; (c) protection of
            quality inputs; and (d) mobilization of non-public
            resources. Bank's performance was satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned were as follows: (a) the decision to use
            adjustment lending to encourage policy reform must take into
            consideration the level of a government's need for
            resources, the strength of the government's mandate and
            the power of diverse constituencies and reflect an analysis
            of the government's ability to commit to reform in
            light of that need; (b) up-front and on-going participation
            of all major stakeholders in the design of reforms is
            essential; (c) public discussion and debate and carefully
            developed information campaigns must be organized,
            pre-tested and conducted prior to and during the
            implementation of reforms; and (d) if adjustment lending is
            to produce desired results, the Bank must be prepared to
            cancel or reduce credit amounts if reforms are not achieved.

docna.cdata!:
Mali - Education Sector Adjustment Credit :
            Credit 2673 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Mali - Education Sector
            Adjustment Credit : Credit 2673 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The purpose of the Education Sector
            Adjustment Credit is to provide critical balance of payment
            support in conjunction with the promotion of the structural
            reforms urgently needed to improve the performance and
            organization of Mali's education system through: (a)
            Improved allocation of resources through measures aimed at
            promoting priority resource allocation to primary education
            and ensuring that the budget is structured in a manner that
            reflects this priority as well as that of improving the
            quality of education; (b) Increased efficiency in the use of
            resources through measures geared, particularly at the
            primary level, to increase access at marginal costs; (c)
            Protection of quality inputs using measures targeting at
            improved pedagogical support to teaching and increased
            availability of teaching materials at all levels of
            education; and (d) Mobilizing non-public resources by
            encouraging private and community financing of primary education.
